article: I was walking in the park with my dog when I saw a notice on a tree saying someone had lost his dog. There was a(n) _ of the dog as well. I thought what a(n) _ it was and then I walked on.  20 minutes later, my dog and I _ our walk and left the park. _ at a red traffic light, I glanced over at a nearby lamp post. There was another _ there, announcing that a dog had been _ !  There was no photo _ there was a phone number. "It couldn't be the _ dog," I thought to myself. "Could it?"  I took out my cell phone, dialed the number and left a message. Then I _ and walked back over to the "Dog Lost" notice. I have to admit I was getting pretty _ at the possibility of _ someone.  When I returned to the first notice, I dialed that number. This time a man picked up the phone. I told him my _ and gave him the _ from the other notice with the "Dog Found" information. He was so happy with the _ that this might be his dog that he could hardly speak. I hung up, _ it was a long shot , but _ that at least I had tried.  About an hour later my cell phone rang. I answered and heard the best possible news. The owner and his dog were _ ! He told me how, when he arrived at the house where his dog was being looked after, it ran to him and jumped into his arms. He _ to pay me a reward but I just laughed and said, "Don't worry about it. Buy the little fellow a doggy treat!"
